title: Data - block on an inclined plane

content.description: In an experiment, students set up an inclined plane at an angle <math alttext="theta " display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>θ</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> on a horizontal lab table. The students release a block from rest on the inclined plane, and the block slides down the incline. The students record data for the time it takes the block to reach the bottom of the plane. This procedure is repeated five times, and the data are shown in the table. Which of the following claims could be supported by the experimental results?
content.question: Trial Time (s) <math alttext="1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> <math alttext="1.25" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>1.25</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> <math alttext="2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> <math alttext="1.35" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>1.35</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> <math alttext="3" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> <math alttext="1.41" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>1.41</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> <math alttext="4" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>4</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> <math alttext="1.51" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>1.51</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> <math alttext="5" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>5</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> <math alttext="1.59" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>1.59</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>

choices.label: A buildup of dust between the block and the plane during each trial caused a decrease in the coefficient of kinetic friction between the two surfaces.
The student placed the block closer to the bottom of the track during each subsequent trial, decreasing the final velocity.
Each time the student placed the block on the inclined plane, the incline was pushed downward, decreasing the angle of the incline.
Contact with the student’s hand during the experiment caused the mass of the block to increase during each trial.
The table that the inclined plane was placed on is tilted slightly upward.

content.answer: Each time the student placed the block on the inclined plane, the incline was pushed downward, decreasing the angle of the incline.

skill.text: 3.B: Apply an appropriate law, definition, theoretical relationship, or model to make a claim.
